definition: to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: Choosing the correct logical starting point is the prerequisite of assuring that accounting theory system is consistent.
sentences.chinese: 而保证前后一贯的前提是正确择定其逻辑起点。

sentences.english: The key to understanding(humor) is to choose a cognitive context that is of optimal relevance.
sentences.chinese: 幽默理解的关键在于择定符合最佳关联的认知语境。

definition: fine time, lucky day (idiom); fig. good opportunity
to reach an agreement/to agree upon
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
to provide (items for an event)/to cater/to make preparations
to pay bride-price (payment to the bride's family in former times)
to fix a date (for an event)/to select an auspicious date
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to employ/to send for sb promising employment
